Private schools, also known to many as independent schools, non-governmental, or nonstate schools, are not administered by local, state or national governments; thus, they retain the right to select their students and are funded in whole or in part by charging their students tuition rather than with public (state) funds.

The University of Texas at Austin (UT, UT Austin, or Texas) is a public research university and the flagship institution of the University of Texas System. Founded in 1883, its campus is located in Austin, Texas, United States, approximately one mile (1.6 km) from the Texas State Capitol.
The University of Texas at Austin (UT, UT Austin, or Texas) is a public research university and the flagship institution of the University of Texas System.

A private school is independent in its finances and governance; it is usually not dependent upon national or local government to finance its operations, nor reliant on taxpayer contributions, and is instead funded by a combination of tuition charges, gifts, and in some cases the investment yield of an endowment.
Public schools are generally primary or secondary schools mandated for or offered to all children without charge, funded in whole or in part by taxation.
Public schools are funded by tax dollars and are, therefore, free to all students. Private schools are funded through tuition, fees, and donations.

A public school in England and Wales is a fee-paying independent school that is independent in its finances and governance; it is not dependent upon national or local government for financing its operations (unlike the state schools in England, which are funded by the government) nor reliant on taxpayer contributions (unlike most private schools). The term "public" is not used in reference to the public provision of education (distinct from private provision). The term dates back to the time when schools were associated with a religious institution and were subject to a church rate, levied as a tax on the population of a parish.
The clock tower is a symbol of a public school.

A public university is a university that is publicly owned or receives significant public funds through a national or subnational government, as opposed to a private university.
A public school in England and Wales is a fee-paying independent secondary school that is independent in its administration and enjoys partial exemption from the Education Act 1996.
The university is a private university.
The University of California is a public university.
